title: [CLI] Do not automatically prefix package name when installing
body:
For now, CLI automatically adds `hyper-` prefix when installing/uninstalling plugins.
`hyper i pane` do exactly the same thing than `hyper i hyper-pane`.
But if user wants to install a plugin with a non standardized name like `hyper i hyperline`, it will try to install `hyper-hyperline`.
It leads to some security problems. If someone forks `hyperline`, adds some malicious code and published it as `hyper-hyperline`...

Please remove any automatically prefixing in CLI.

title: Nano editor doesn't close when ssh tunnel killed
body:
I SSH'd into a server and opened up a log file in nano. I then locked the laptop and left it over night. When looking at the terminal this morning nano was still open but the text to say the connection has been closed was over the top of nano. I had to return multiple lines to get past nano.

(can't provide screenshot because of sensitive information)
author: silverlight513

comments.body:
expected behaviour
nano, less, tmux etc. are curses applications and they need to send the `endwin` sequence while closing
Since you were using ssh, and the connection broke, these sequences were never received and so terminal content from before didn't restore.
If needed, you can just do a `ls | less` and exit `less` using `q` and it will restore the terminal.

body:

That way, the `index.js` does _less_, we don't need to maintain subscriptions for title publishing, no blur / focus, etc. <HyperTerm> will execute the commands directly.
